evidence_span: the tube microstructure consists of about 80% beta zirconium phase and 20% alpha zirconium phase
composition_raw: beta zirconium phase: 80%; alpha zirconium phase: 20%

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_005_chunk2
evidence_span: extruded tubes contain alpha grains up to about 10 μm long, about 1 μm wide, and about 0.5 μm thick

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_005_chunk2
evidence_span: grain boundary network of metastable beta zirconium phase that contains 18 to 20 ut% niobium

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_005_chunk2
evidence_span: Cold drawing causes additional elongation of the alpha grains and introduces a high density of dislocations to the microstructure

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_005_chunk2
evidence_span: Stress relieving pressure tubes at 73 reduces the dislocation density without causing any recrystallization to occur

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_005_chunk2
evidence_span: stress relieving at temperatures less than 883 K will also cause the metastable beta phase to eventually decompose to an equilibrium structure consisting of alpha zirconium and beta niobium

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_005_chunk2
evidence_span: Heating at 673 K for 72 h before testing had accelerated this transformation to the omega phase

evidence_span: Heating at 773 K for 10 h before testing with the beta phase network showing decomposition to alpha phase and chains of discrete niobium rich particles

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_005_chunk2
evidence_span: Corrosion of binary zirconium-niobium alloys is known to be dependent on the amount of niobium in solid solution with minimum rates observed at concentrations close to the equilibrium levels

evidence_span: Thermally ageing cold-worked Zr-2.5Nb pressure tubes in the temperature range, 673 to $7 7 3 \mathrm { ~ K ~ }$ , improves their out-reactor oxidation resistance in water

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_005_chunk5
evidence_span: Both the oxidation and deuterium pickup of cold-worked $\mathbf { Z  r { - } } 2 . 5 \mathbf { N } \mathbf { b }$ pressure tubes in CANDU-PHW reactors are substantially less than that for cold-worked Zircaloy-2 pressure tubes after similar operating histories

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_005_chunk5
evidence_span: Both the oxidation and deuterium pickup of cold-worked $\mathbf { Z  r { - } } 2 . 5 \mathbf { N } \mathbf { b }$ pressure tubes in CANDU-PHW reactors are substantially less than that for cold-worked Zircaloy-2 pressure tubes after similar operating histories

evidence_span: Both thermal ageing and fast neutron irradiation of cold-worked Zr-2.5Nb tubes produce microstructural changes towards a more equilibrium structure

evidence_span: The oxides on $\mathbf { Z  r { - } } 2 . 5 \mathbf { N } \mathbf { b }$ pressure tubes were compact and granular, consisting of clusters of smal, sub-micron sized grains, which become difficult to resolve near the metal oxide interface
